title: PM Harini calls for a prosperous nation where children thrive and elders live with dignity
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya says that the government is committed to creating a safe, supportive, and child-friendly environment while protecting children from abuse, labour, and stress, and ensuring their growth with dignity and knowledge.

title: Strong earthquake kills 31 people in a central Philippine region hit by deadly storm just days ago
byline: An offshore earthquake of magnitude 6.9 collapsed walls of houses and buildings late Tuesday in a central Philippine province, killing at least 31 people, injuring many others and sending residents scrambling out of homes into darkness as the intense shaking cut off power, officials said.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: A few showers may occur in Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (01), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: President Dissanayake meets Emperor Naruhito
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, on an official visit to Japan at the invitation of the Japanese government has met Emperor Naruhito at the Imperial Palace on Tuesday (30).

title: Underworld figure ‘Tinker’ extradited from Dubai
byline: Underworld figure Sridaran Niranjan, also known as ‘Tinker’, who was arrested in Dubai has been brought back to Sri Lanka this morning (01), police confirmed.

title: Cigarettes, cosmetics and e-cigarettes worth over Rs. 9.5 mln seized at BIA
byline: A consignment of foreign cigarettes, cosmetics, and e-cigarettes worth over Rs. 9.5 million has been seized by Sri Lanka Customs officials at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake.

title: “Let’s build a Sri Lanka where children and elders live with security and dignity” – President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake says that the government is fully committed to safeguarding the rights and wellbeing of both generations on the World Children’s Day and Elder’s Day and that it will continue to work tirelessly to enhance the welfare of children and elders.

title: Chinese envoy hails ‘multi-faceted’ bilateral exchanges between Sri Lanka and China
byline: Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong has reaffirmed their enduring friendship with Sri Lanka, highlighting strong bilateral cooperation in development projects, public welfare initiatives, and crisis response.

title: Case against Keheliya Rambukwella and family fixed for pre-trial conference
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Bribery Commission against former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella, his wife, and four other family members for the illegal acquisition of assets worth over Rs. 97 million be called for further pre-trial conference on October 15.

title: Philippines quake death toll rises to 69, official says
byline: The death toll from a 6.9-magnitude earthquake that hit the central Philippines has risen to 69, a disaster official said on Wednesday as the government mobilised agencies to search for survivors and restore power and water supplies.

title: TV Derana celebrates World Children’s Day with first-ever aerial tour for schoolchildren
byline: Marking a historic initiative, TV Derana today commemorated World Children’s Day by organizing a SriLankan Airlines charter flight carrying 250 schoolchildren on an aerial tour around Sri Lanka.

title: President Dissanayake returns after concluding official visit to Japan
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake returned to Sri Lanka this morning (01) after successfully completing a three-day official visit to Japan, undertaken at the invitation of the Japanese Government.

title: US government shutdown begins as partisan division rules Washington
byline: The U.S. government shut down much of its operations on Wednesday as deep partisan divisions prevented Congress and the White House from reaching a funding deal, setting off what could be a long, grueling standoff that could lead to the loss of thousands of federal jobs.

title: Litro Gas prices to remain unchanged in October
byline: The prices of Litro Gas domestic cylinder refills will remain unchanged for the month of October 2025, the Litro Gas Company has announced.

title: Tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka surpass 1.7 million in 2025
byline: The number of tourist arrivals to Sri Lanka so far in 2025 has surpassed 1.7 million.

title: US government faces brain drain as 154,000 federal workers exit this week
byline: More than 150,000 federal employees will leave the U.S. government payroll this week after accepting buyouts - the largest single-year exodus of civil servants in nearly 80 years, triggering what unions and governance experts warn is a damaging loss of institutional expertise.

title: Development officers to be recruited for teaching service – Education Min.
byline: The Ministry of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Training has issued a statement regarding the recruitment of development officers currently assigned to schools to the teaching service.

title: No Laugfs Gas price revision in October
byline: Laugfs Gas PLC has confirmed that there will be no price revision for domestic gas cylinder refills in the month of October 2025.

title: Cache of firearms and ammunition uncovered from Kataragama Weheragala Reservoir
byline: A stock of weapons including 74 T-56 magazines, 35 LMG drums, 5 MPMG drum boxes, and several unidentified magazines has been discovered in the Kataragama Weheragala Reservoir.

title: Fee to be charged for plastic shopping bags from November?
byline: The Supreme Court has been informed that a gazette notification is expected to be issued by November 1, making it mandatory to charge a fee for plastic shopping bags, so they can no longer be given free of charge by traders. MORE?

title: USD 1 billion in vehicles imported in 8 months, Aug records highest expenditure
byline: Following the lifting of restrictions on vehicle imports, the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has reported that the country spent US$1,007.5 million on vehicle imports during the eight-month period from January to August 2025.

title: Gaza flotilla says Israeli vessels intimidated its boats as it nears blockade
byline: The international flotilla trying to deliver aid to Gaza said Israeli vessels approached some of its boats and engaged in “dangerous and intimidatory manoeuvres” on Wednesday as it neared the war-stricken strip.

title: Revised indictment served on ex-Minister Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, his wife and six others
byline: A revised indictment was served before the Colombo High Court today (01) against former Minister of Petroleum Resources Development Anura Priyadharshana Yapa, his wife, and six other defendants.

title: Shah Rukh Khan emerges as India’s most prolific star: IMDb Report
byline: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan has been named India’s most prolific star, featuring in 20 out of 130 most popular Indian movies over the past 25 years, according to a new report by IMDb.

title: 45 students of Bakamuna school hospitalised due to food poisoning
byline: Around 45 students from a Primary School in Bakamuna, Hingurakgoda have been hospitalised due to food poisoning.

title: Snapchat to start charging for storing old posts
byline: Snapchat is going to start charging for storing old photos and videos users keep on the platform.

title: Business chambers file petition challenging VAT collection without refund system and abolition of SVAT
byline: The Free Trade Zone Manufacturers’ Association, the National Chamber of Commerce of Sri Lanka and the Sri Lanka Chamber of Small and Medium Industries have filed a writ application before the Appeals Court challenging the decision by the Inland Revenue Department to commence collecting Value Added Tax from today.

title: “It’s our collective responsibility to ensure safety of all children”: PM Harini
byline: It is our collective responsibility to ensure the safety of all children, leave no child behind, regardless of background or circumstance, safeguard their economic, social and mental well-being, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: Actor Vijay’s statewide tour called off days after 41 died in Karur rally stampede
byline: Actor-politician Vijay’s party, TVK, has suspended his statewide tour for two weeks after a stampede in Tamil Nadu’s Karur claimed 41 lives and triggered massive outrage.

title: Teacher hospitalised after assault by student
byline: A teacher at a prominent school in Monaragala has been injured and hospitalised following an assault by a student.

title: Gazette issued on mandatory seat belts for vehicles traveling on expressways
byline: A gazette notification has been issued by the Ministry of Highways making it mandatory for drivers and all passengers of vehicles traveling along expressways to wear seat belts.

title: German national Pay Drechsel receives first residence visa under newly introduced visa scheme
byline: The first residence visa under the newly introduced ‘Single Individual Investor Category’, in accordance with regulations published in the Extraordinary Gazette No. 2360/24 dated November 27, 2023 has been issued to German National Dr. Pay Drechsel today.

title: Fitch affirms Sri Lanka at ‘CCC+’
byline: Fitch Ratings has affirmed Sri Lanka’s Long-Term Foreign-Currency Issuer Default Rating (IDR) at ‘CCC+’.

title: Gazette issued on mandatory seat belts for all vehicles traveling on expressways
byline: A gazette notification has been issued by the Ministry of Highways making it mandatory for drivers and all passengers of vehicles traveling along expressways to wear seat belts.

title: Son of ‘Kajja’ responds to allegations linking his father to Wasim Thajudeen’s case
byline: The eldest son of Aruna Vidanagamage, also known as Kajja, who was recently murdered in Middeniya, issued a public statement today (01) through social and electronic media, responding to recent revelations made by his late father’s wife.

title: Discussion held on establishing RMIT Sri Lanka Innovation Hub
byline: A special discussion has been held at the Presidential Secretariat between the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT) and officials of the Presidential Secretariat, with the objective of raising awareness and facilitating the establishment of an RMIT Innovation Hub in Sri Lanka.
